text: Should a web app use its own public API to display data?
I'm starting to build a site that as most do, displays data in various ways from a database.
I'm building a public REST API as part of this project, and will be designing this in parallel with the main site, as I believe that it's an integral feature.
Should the site itself use the public API when retrieving data, or should it use a different method?
It seems silly to duplicate code in this way, but I'm not sure if there will be a speed issue.
